label: 百僚
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: The hundred bureaus, a corporate term used in the Chinese Rites of Chou to denote the royal bureaucracy. The phrase appears frequently in Yamato court records, but in the eighth century it was replaced by hyakkan 百官, an expression associated with the ritsuryō codes. [律令]"
